Articles.Content:
Hello everyone!

Just got this game four days ago and wanted to stop by and make a contribution to The Kerbal Space Program

The ABR-II

It uses four LVT-30 and 1 LVT-45 Engines for liftoff purposes in the first stage which can reach about 90km in under 3 minutes if you go straight up. (When I took this image, I forgot to put my Gimbaling engine in the first stage, the uploaded CRAFT file has that little hick-up fixed.)

During the second stage, the four LVT-30s are discarded and the LVT-45 is used to correct orbit and transfer to the Mun

The third and final powered stage can be used for to get the Mun and return safely

Extra notes:

-The Third stage has only half a tank of fuel, so if you aren\'t careful you can run out fairly quickly

-The second stage of the rocket can power you to the Mun if you plan it right and the third stage can actually get you into and out of a stable orbit with the Mun and even Minmus

-The first stage has five boosters but only four of the gas tanks are used

-ABR stands for 'Abraham' I intend to name my line of space vehicles using bible characters

This vehicle could probably even be made to land on the Mun if it had some landing gear; My piloting skills and knowledge are extremely poor so far so I am content with just making countless passes of the Mun. I am trying to design now a ABR-III which will probably include landing gear on the final stage and replace the LV-45 for the 909. Still with this very minimalist build it would have to make use of slingshots and what not, something I really cannot do at the moment, seeing as I still have issues getting into Munar Orbit Alone XD.
